10 January.event: ISIL managed to push back rebel forces on the eastern approaches to Ar-Raqqah. ISIL forces also killed 20 rebel fighters in fighting in the town of Al-Bab in Aleppo province,

refs.text: Al Qaeda group fights back against Syria rebel assault

10 January.event: and managed to capture wheat silos and mills just outside the town.

refs.text: 500 Reported Killed In Rebel Infighting In Syria

10 January.event: ISIL commander Abu Omar al-Shishani entered the town with a convoy of 30 vehicles and troops after he lifted the ISIL's siege of Deir-az-Zor airport.

refs.text: protest march in Aleppo, 10 January 2014

10 June.event: The city of Mosul falls to ISIL after four days of clashes between the insurgents and Iraqi military.

refs.text: Mosul falls to militants, Iraqi forces flee northern city

11 January.event: Rebels moved a convoy including tanks and technicals to Saraqeb in preparation to push ISIL out.

refs.text: Rebels clash in north Syria, bodies pile up in hospital - monitors

11 January.event: Heavy fighting erupted and it was reported that rebels took over most of the town, and besieged hundreds of ISIL fighters. Earlier in the day, five rebels were killed on the outskirts of Saraqeb when their car hit a bomb.

refs.text: NGO: Syria jihadists kill rebels in bombing

11 January.event: Meanwhile, ISIL forces managed to capture the border town of Tal Abyad, while in Ar-Raqqah ISIL fighters captured a rebel checkpoint and the train station.

refs.text: Syrian troops advance on Aleppo area: activists

11 January.event: ISIL fighters also dumped the corpses of dozens of their foes at the village of Jazra, to the west of Ar-Raqqah. Dozens of bodies of ISIL fighters were also reportedly in Ar-Raqqah's hospital.

refs.text: Rebels clash in north Syria, bodies pile up in hospital - monitors

11 January.event: Rebels managed to regain territory lost in previous days in Aleppo province and were defending against ISIL counterattacks. 20 rebels were killed in fighting in the town of Anadan,

refs.text: Rage grows against both ISIL and rebel leaders

11 January.event: while 30 rebels were killed in three days of fighting in the village of al-Tiba, northeast of Sekhna.

refs.text: 294 died yesterday, including 210 combat battalions of regular troops and

12 January.event: It was confirmed that rebel forces had captured the eastern part of Saraqeb with the local ISIL commander surrounded with his fighters in the center of the town.

refs.text: Syrian opposition and ISIS continue Idlib battle

12 January.event: Fighting was still continuing in Ar-Raqqah between ISIL and remnants of rebel units, including the Al-Nusra Front,

refs.text: Group linked to al-Qaeda regains ground in northeast Syria

12 January.event: although by this point ISIL had captured much of the city.

refs.text: Syria conflict: 700 killed in eight days in early January, Syrian Observatory for Human Rights says

12 January.event: According to an opposition activist, 95 percent of Ar-Raqqah and its countryside were under ISIL control. ISIL forces had also captured the towns of Hrietan and Basraton in Aleppo province.

refs.text: Group linked to al-Qaeda regains ground in northeast Syria

12 January.event: It was also reported that the bodies of 70 rebels were delivered to Ar-Raqqah's hospital after they were executed by ISIL following their capture of Tal Abyad. Another report put the number of executed prisoners at 100.

refs.text: Al Qaeda Syria unit executes dozens of rivals in Raqqa: activists

13 January.event: It was reported that ISIL had won the battle for of Ar-Raqqah capturing most of the province and the provincial capital.

refs.text: Syria, anti-Assad rebel infighting leaves 700 dead, including civilians
Al-Qaida-Linked Group Ousts Rivals From Syria Town

13 January.event: and Beza'a, while the rebels were gaining ground in Jarabulus, near the Turkish border.

refs.text: ISIS jihadists seize 'most' of north Syria town: activists

13 January.event: Another mass execution of prisoners was also reported near the village of Kantari, about 80 kilometers north of Ar-Raqqah, when ISIL killed 46 captured fighters of the Ahrar ash-Sham rebel group.

refs.text: Al-Qaida-Linked Group Ousts Rivals From Syria Town

13 January.event: 14 rebels were also executed in Homs province

refs.text: Jihadists seize Syria town, 'execute 60'

14 January.event: It was reported that rebels captured the villages of Masqan,

refs.text: Opposition forces seize Masqan in Aleppo as ISIL tightens grip over Al-Bab

14 January.event: Kafar Kalbin and Kafra in Aleppo province, while the ISIL has taken full control of Ar-Raqqah city, after the last remaining rebels retreated.

refs.text: ISIL recaptures Raqqa from Syria’s rebels

14 January.event: Meanwhile, the rebels also captured the prison in Jarablus, releasing 70 prisoners from ISIL custody.

refs.text: Rebel factions oust ISIL from most of Jarablos in Aleppo

15 January.event: An ISIL car bomb in Jarablus killed 26 people, of which 23 were rebel fighters and three were civilians. Meanwhile, in Saraqeb fighting was continuing and opposition sources reported that the local ISIL commander, a Belgian, was killed. ISIL denied the claim.

refs.text: Car bomb blamed on al Qaeda kills 26 in north Syrian town

15 January.event: Between 15 and 17 January, rebels captured Jibreen, Hardntin Kfarrakeshr,

refs.text: Phalange fighter captures the villages and Jibreen Hardntin Brive Aleppo
Combat battalions controlled Alr another village Brive Aleppo

15 January.event: Sheikh Ali, Aajel, 46th base, Orum al-Sughra and Reef al-Muhandiseen, while the ISIL retreated from the village of Kafarjoum, which holds the largest ISIL arms depots in all of Syria.

refs.text: Al-Mujahideen Army ousts ISIL from Ratyan in Aleppo

15 January.event: ISIL also withdrew from Saraqab, burning their vehicles as they retreated, while at the same time ISIL recaptured Jarabulus.

refs.text: Syrian rebels push Qaeda affiliate from northwest stronghold

17 July.event: Syria's Shaer gas field in Homs Governorate was seized by ISIL. According to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights (SOHR), at least 90 National Defence Force guards defending the field were killed, as were 21 ISIL fighters.

refs.text: Islamic State fighters seize Syria gas field

17 July.event: The SOHR later put the death toll from the fighting and the killing of prisoners at 270 soldiers, militiamen and staff, and at least 40 ISIL fighters.

refs.text: Islamic state killed 270 during Syrian gas field takeover: monitor

20 January.event: 2 suicide car bombs exploded at the Bab Al-Hawa border crossing, 16 people including six rebels were killed.

refs.text: Syrie: 16 morts dans un double attentat

20 January.event: The same day, ISIL forces seized control of the Al-Jarah military airport.

refs.text: Syrie: 16 morts dans un double attentat

20 January.event: In Manbij, a large suicide car explosion killed 20 people, including rebels, women, and children

refs.text: 3 suicide car explosions in Aleppo and Idlib

20 January.event: By 23 January, ISIL was in full control of Manbij

refs.text: Zawahri urges end to deadly clashes between rebels and jihadists

20 January.event: and completely secured Darkush the following day.

refs.text: ISIS have completely taken over the town of Darkoush

25 May.event: Syrian rebels completely secure Khan Shaykhun and its surroundings in the 2014 Idlib offensive, capturing the al-Salam checkpoint west of the town.

refs.text: المرصد السورى لحقوق الإنسان - المرصد السورى لحقوق الإنسان

27 April.event: Iraqi helicopters reportedly destroyed an ISIL convoy inside Syria. This may be the first time that Iraqi forces have struck outside their country since the Gulf War.

refs.text: Iraq hits 'jihadist convoy' in Syria

27 January.event: It was reported that ISIL senior Commander Sameer Abid Mohammed al-Halefawi (aka Haji Bakr) was killed by rebels in Tal Rifaat, near Azaz,

refs.text: Key Al-Qaida Militant Reportedly Killed in Syria

27 January.event: and at least two other ISIL senior commanders were captured at Hreitan. Four ISIL fighters and three rebels were killed in the fighting.

refs.text: ISIS leaders killed, captured in Aleppo

27 January.event: ISIL confirmed the death of top ISIL leader Haji Bakr on 2 February.

refs.text: ISIS confirms death of senior leader in Syria

27 March.event: The Syrian army shelled the Kurdish-held neighbourhood of al-Msheirfah in Al-Hasakah city.

refs.text: Clashes between YPG and ISIS around Hasakah

27 March.event: The Syrian Kurdish news agency ANHA, citing a YPG source, stated that the attack began at 11:30 AM, and that mortar shells fired by the army struck the YPG's "Martyr Shiyar" office and a cotton mill, causing material damage.

refs.text: النظام يقصف مقرات وحدات حماية الشعب في حسكة

27 March.event: This incident occurred while the YPG was fighting off an ISIS attack against the town of Jaz'ah near Ya'rubiyah.

refs.text: مقتل أكثر من 30 مرتزقاً في محيط جزعة

31 March.event: Members of the pro-government National Defence Force shot a YPG fighter in Al-Qamishli city. The YPG responded by launching an operation in the Qadour Bek district of Qamishli, killing seven pro-government fighters and detaining 10 others. It was also reported that the YPG captured parts of the Qadour Bek district, including the Customs Building and the Qamishli's Bread Factory.

refs.text: Kurdish YPG forces respond to Syrian government militants in Qamishli

4 March.event: ISIL retreated from the border town of Azaz and nearby villages, choosing instead to consolidate around Ar-Raqqah, in anticipation of an escalation of fighting with al-Nusra.

refs.text: Renegade al-Qaida faction withdraws from Syrian border town of Azaz

7 January.event: It was confirmed that 34 foreign ISIL and Jund al-Aqsa fighters had been executed in the previous few days by rebels in the Jabal al-Zawiya area.

refs.text: 34 jihadists dead after rebel clashes in Syria's Idlib: activists

7 January.event: ISIL retreated from al-Mayadeen in Deir ez-Zor Governorate, without any fighting with rebel forces.

refs.text: Today In

7 January.event: East of Rastan, in the Homs Governorate, ISIL attacked a rebel headquarters, killing 15 rebel fighters.

refs.text: Clashes Athalasalamahtantql to Homs and killed 15 fighters in the vicinity of Rastan

7 January.event: During the day, it was revealed that during the previous evening, ISIL executed up to 50 prisoners in the Qadi al-Askar district of Aleppo. The dead included media activists, relief workers, and other civilians.

refs.text: Al-Qaeda group kills Aleppo prisoners: report

7 January.event: According to the opposition SOHR, 42 people were executed, including, 21 rebel fighters and five media activists.

refs.text: Syria rebels seize al-Qaida base in north

8 January.event: Rebels captured the ISIL headquarters in Aleppo city at the Children's hospital in the Qadi Askar district. ISIL forces lost control over opposition-held areas of the city and retreated to Al-Inzarat on the northeastern outskirts of Aleppo. 300 hostages held by the radical jihadists were set free.

refs.text: Aleppo free of ISIL control, rebel commander says

8 January.event: In Ar-Raqqah, the hospital was abandoned, bodies were lying in the central square and there was no power or water leaving the city "completely paralyzed", according to an opposition activist. At this point, ISIL controlled two key routes out of Raqqa: to the east toward the Iraqi border and also the road north to the Turkish frontier.

refs.text: As Rebels Fight Rebels, Grim Reports From A Syrian City

8 January.event: The head of the al-Nusra Front, Abu Mohammad al-Golani, confirmed that fighting had taken place between his organization and ISIL and called for mediation and an end to the "infighting."

refs.text: Al-Qaeda’s ISIL vows to ‘crush’ Syrian rebels

8 January.event: Late in the day, ISIL started a counterattack, as it launched car bomb assaults targeting opposition checkpoints. Three attacks took place in Al-Bab, Hreitan, and Jarabulus in the Aleppo Governorate, Observatory director Rami Abdel Rahman told AFP. He said similar overnight attacks took place in the Aleppo Governorate, while one occurred in Mayadin in the eastern Deir ez-Zor Governorate. The attack in Al-Bab killed nine people.

refs.text: Jihadists battle back in north Syria, says monitor

February 2014.event: Al-Qaeda's general command broke off its links with ISIL, reportedly to concentrate the Islamist effort on unseating President Bashar al-Assad.

refs.text: Al Qaeda breaks link with Syrian militant group ISIL
